The instructions emphasize describing motion, and in a video of a city, even an aerial one, there would likely be visible movement. For instance, I can imagine seeing faint streams of traffic moving along highways or major streets, or perhaps a train moving on a track through the city. The caption completely omits these potential subject motions. Furthermore, the description of the camera's action could be more precise; instead of just "ascends," a more detailed description like "ascends vertically while tilting upward" would better capture the dynamic reveal of the cityscape. The current structure describes the scene spatially (foreground, mid-ground, background) rather than chronologically, failing to fully capture how the view unfolds over time as the camera moves.
